frame.name: Reading_aloud
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> interprets a written <fen>Text</fen> and speaks the contents, usually to an <fen>Addressee</fen>. The contents may be the <fen>Text</fen> verbatim or a representation of the text.
<ex>I do think <fex name="Speaker">they</fex> <t>read</t> <fex name="Addressee">to them</fex> <fex name="Time">when they are little</fex>. <fex name="Text">INI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Place">Inside the flat</fex> <fex name="Speaker">a fruity voice</fex> was <t>reading</t> <t>out</t> <fex name="Text">a list of figures which had something to do with the production of the pig-iron</fex>. <fex name="Addressee">DNI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition: <def-root>The person or people to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> is directing the reading of the <fen>Text</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The way that the <fen>Speaker</fen> reads the <fen>Text</fen> aloud.</def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>The medium from which the <fen>Text</fen> is read.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The result that the <fen>Speaker</fen> is trying to achieve by reading aloud.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location at which the reading takes place.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The method by which the <fen>Text</fen> is read aloud by the <fen>Speaker</fen>. <ex>My mother always <t>read</t> to me <fex name="Means">by candle light</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

lexUnit.name: read.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to interpret and speak aloud (the contents of a written message)

lexUnit.name: read out.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to pronounce a written text out loud.
